abstract.text: An object describing the content of a widget that uses a custom intent
to provide user-configurable options.

inlineContent.text: The following example shows the configuration for a game widget that
displays details about a chosen character.

is a custom App Intent containing user-editable
The timeline provider is an object that determines the timeline for
refreshing your widget. Providing future dates for updating your widget
allows the system to optimize the refresh process.
The content closure contains the SwiftUI views that WidgetKit needs to
render the widget. When WidgetKit invokes the content closure, it passes a
timeline entry created by the widget providerâ€™s
Modifiers let you specify the families your widget supports, and the
details shown when users add or edit their widgets.

abstract.text: Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
An object describing the content of a widget that uses a custom intent
to provide user-configurable options.
Creates a configuration for a widget by using a custom intent
to provide user-configurable options.
An object that describes a recommended intent configuration for a
user-customizable widget.
Provides a timeline entry representing the current time and state of a
widget.
Provides an array of timeline entries for the current time and,
optionally, any future times to update a widget.
An object describing the content of a widget that uses a custom intent
definition to provide user-configurable options.
An object that describes a recommended intent configuration for a
user-customizable widget.
Give people the option to customize their widgets by adding a custom app intent
to your project.
Configure your widgets for backward compatibility.

doc://com.apple.WidgetKit/documentation/.title: Migrating widgets from SiriKit Intents to App Intents

abstract.text: Donate intents and indicate relevance to automatically show your widget in Smart Stacks when it has useful information to display.

doc://com.apple.WidgetKit/documentation/.title: Increasing the visibility of widgets in Smart Stacks

abstract.text: An object that contains a list of user-configured widgets and is used for
reloading widget timelines.
A structure that contains information about user-configured widgets.
Runs the given action when the system provides a background task.
The content and behavior of this widget.
Sets the name shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the specified string.
Sets the name shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the contents of a text view.
Sets the localized name shown for a widget when a user adds or edits the widget.
Sets the description shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the contents of a text view.
Sets the description shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the specified string.
Sets the localized description shown for a widget when a user adds or edits the widget.
Adds an action to perform when events related to a URL session identified by a closure are waiting to be processed.
Adds an action to perform when events related to a URL session with a matching identifier are waiting to be processed.
Sets the sizes that a widget supports.
An interface for configuring a WidgetKit widget.
A type that describes a widgetâ€™s content.
A type that represents part of your appâ€™s user interface and provides modifiers that you use to configure views.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
